clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Inflammatory Symptoms Reduction With Amoxicillin + Ketoprofen in Acute Pharyngeal Tonsillitis in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Local, Phase IV, Multicenter, Double-blind, Randomized, Parallel, With Two Treatment Arms, Placebo-controlled Study to Evaluate the Reduction of Inflammatory Symptoms in the Treatment of Bacterial Pharyngitis With Ketoprofen and Amoxicillin in Pediatric Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the inflammatory symptoms and signs (hyperemia, edema and pain) reduction after 24 hours of treatment with ketoprofen drops when associated to amoxicillin.

detailed_description.textblock: The total duration of the study period per patient is 10 Â± 1 day

clinical_study.why_stopped: Recruitment challenges despite several attenpts to increase enrollment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with reduction of inflammatory signs and symptoms after 24 hours of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with reduction of inflammatory signs and symptoms after 72 hours of treatment
Number of patients with reduction of inflammatory signs and symptoms with no use of rescue medication
Number of patients who used rescue medication after randomization.

arm_group.description: Ketoprofen + Amoxicillin for 3 days, then Amoxicillin alone for 7 days
Placebo (for ketoprofen) + Amoxicillin for 3 days, then Amoxicillin alone for 7 days
